# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> string(year(x), zero_padding(length(string(month(x))), 2) * 10 + month(x), Number) for x in df.dt)
    df
end
```
This function `add_yearmonth` takes a DataFrame as its argument and adds a new column named `ym`. It uses the `map` function to apply an anonymous function on every element of the `dt` column to extract year and month, concatenate them with zero padding for the month number and create a string. Finally, it converts this string back to a Number type so that it can be stored in the DataFrame as a numeric value.
